title.narrative: Development and Delivery of Biofortified Crops at Scale

description.narrative: The goal of the project is to contribute to improved nutritional status of at least 6.5 million resource-poor women of child-bearing age, adolescent girls, and children under five in participating countries in Africa and Asia, specifically Bangladesh, Ethiopia, Kenya, Nigeria and Uganda. The project’s purpose is to develop and deliver biofortified sweetpotato varieties in these countries in an effective, efficient and equitable way; and to generate rigorous evidence and new knowledge that will stimulate and guide further investments in the utilization of biofortified crops for nutrition goals. The project pursues this objective through three outputs: (i) Developing new biofortified varieties of sweetpotato through existing breeding programmes; (ii) Supporting the development of new sustainable delivery models for scaling biofortified sweetpotato, including new public private partnerships and cost-effective delivery models in protracted crises environments; and (iii) Strengthening the evidence base on the impact of biofortified sweetpotato, and ensuring biofortification is included in international, regional, and national policies, plans, and programmes.

participating-org.narrative: Centre for Dryland Agriculture, Bayero University

department.narrative: The Resilient Nutritious Sweetpotato Program for Africa, Asia and Haiti

job-title.narrative: Principal Investigator for the Development and Delivery of Biofortified Crops at Scale Project

title.narrative: CIP Proposal to DFID "Scaling Up Biofortification Through Sweetpotato" Programme Phase II 2019-2022

condition.narrative: Continuation of the MoU after Year 1 will be dependent upon satisfactory progress and value for money being achieved each previous year.

title.narrative: At least 6.7 million farm households are growing biofortified crops, and a total of at least 34.9 million people in farm and non-farm households are consuming biofortified foods by 2022.

description.narrative: Note that: 50% of the people will be in target groups that include women of reproductive age, under 5’s, and adolescent girls.

target.value: Additional 250,000 farm households over baseline are growing OFSP

comment.narrative: Additional 250,000 over baseline (20% in fragile contexts) of which 10,000 reached through humanitarian programs

actual.value: Additional 329,767 farm households over baseline are growing OFSP

comment.narrative: Additional 329,767 farm households are growing OFSP Fragile contexts: 61% Through humanitarian programs: 58,444

comment.narrative: Additional 100,000 over baseline (10% in fragile contexts)

target.value: Additional 500,000 farm households over baseline are growing OFSP

comment.narrative: Additional 500,000 over baseline; (60% in fragile contexts) of which 100,000 reached through humanitarian programs.

title.narrative: Increased production of biofortified crops.
Proportion of crop area that is allocated to biofortified varieties (increase over baseline).

comment.narrative: OFSP: at least 1% increase over baseline.
No progress reported for this indicator. This will be determined after baseline surveys have been conducted in target countries.
OFSP: at least 2% increase over baseline.

actual.value: OFSP has increased by at least 3.6% over the baseline

comment.narrative: OFSP has increased by at least 3.6% over the baseline in Bangladesh (11%), Ethiopia (0.9%), Kenya (3%), Uganda (4.5%), Malawi (2.8%) and Mozambique (4%)
OFSP: at least 3% increase over baseline.

actual.value: OFSP has increased by at least 5% over the baseline

comment.narrative: The proportion of sweetpotato area allocated to OFSP has increased by at least 5% over the baseline in Bangladesh (12%), Ethiopia (2.1%), Kenya (3.1%), Uganda (4.8%), Malawi (2.9%) and Mozambique (4.3%).
OFSP: at least 4% increase over baseline.

actual.value: 62.5M OFSP vine cuttings over baseline

comment.narrative: Farmers acquired more than 62.5M OFSP vine cuttings in Bangladesh (8.8M), Ethiopia (15.4M), Kenya (12.1M), Nigeria (1.3M), Uganda (17.5M), Malawi (7.1M) and Mozambique (0.13M).

actual.value: 4.3 M OFSP additional vine cuttings over baseline

comment.narrative: More than 4.3m vine cuttings distributed in continuation of previous programme phase. Some 387,600 OFSP vine cuttings have been distributed using new delivery mechanisms in Bangladesh and Kenya

target.value: OFSP: 80 million additional vine cuttings over baseline

target.value: OFSP: Increase by at least 8,000 MT over baseline

comment.narrative: Due to delays in vine cuttings, OFSP roots production will commence in the next cropping season for Bangladesh, Ethiopia, Kenya, and Uganda.

target.value: OFSP: Increase by at least 160,000 MT over baseline

title.narrative: Number of households that acquired seed/planting material annually, of which 15% were reached through humanitarian seed distribution programs, disaggregated by crop, sex of recipient and geographic location.

target.value: OFSP: 200,000 households

actual.value: At least 231,102 HH acquired OFSP vine cuttings. Of these, at least 73,056 (31%) were reached through humanitarian programs.

comment.narrative: At least 231,102 households acquired OFSP vine cuttings in Bangladesh (17,608), Ethiopia (29,480), Kenya (90,640), Nigeria (6,030), Uganda (50,867), Malawi (35,599) and Mozambique (878). Of these, at least 73,056 (31%) were reached through humanitarian programs in Bangladesh (810), Ethiopia (14,740), Kenya (2,658), Uganda (18,634), Malawi (35,599), and Mozambique (615)

target.value: OFSP: 280,000 households (85,000 through humanitarian programs)

actual.value: At least 443,702 HH acquired OFSP vine cuttings (213,787 through humanitarian programs)

comment.narrative: At least 443,702 households acquired OFSP vine cuttings in Bangladesh (53,314), Ethiopia (93,433), Kenya (106,334), Nigeria (6,544), Uganda (105,755), Malawi (63,730) and Mozambique (14,572). Of these, at least 213,787 (48%) were reached through humanitarian programs in Bangladesh (2,060), Ethiopia (78,693), Kenya (8,835), Uganda (50,268), Malawi (63,730), and Mozambique (10,201)

target.value: OFSP: 100,000 households

actual.value: More than 121,000 HH received planting material in continuation of previous programme phase from various partners

comment.narrative: More than 121,000 HH received planting material in continuation of previous programme phase from various partners. Through new delivery mechanisms, 362 additional HH (62 men, 300 women) reached in Bangladesh and Kenya.

target.value: OFSP: 300,000 households (100,000 through humanitarian programs)

title.narrative: At least 10 new biofortified varieties of OFSP are released or recommended for release; and at least 15 varieties are registered in additional countries.
Number of new biofortified varieties developed and recommended for release.

target.value: 3 new OFSP clones recommended for release

actual.value: 3 new OFSP clones recommended for release

comment.narrative: 3 OFSP varieties were officially released: 2 in Ethiopia (‘Ukr/Eju-10/Alamura’ and ‘Ukr/Eju-13/Dilla’) and 1 in Kenya (‘Silklow 6’).

target.value: 12 new OFSP clones recommended for release (no hybrids)

actual.value: 12 new OFSP clones recommended for release

comment.narrative: A total of 12 new OFSP clones have been recommended for release across four countries: Bangladesh (3), Kenya (3), Mozambique (5), and Malawi (1). Hybrid clones: 500 hybrid clones advancing to trials in both Mozambique and Uganda

target.value: 4 new OFSP clones recommended for release (including at least 1 hybrid clone)

actual.value: 9 new OFSP clones have been recommended for release across three countries: Bangladesh (3), Kenya (1), Mozambique (5)

target.value: 10 new OFSP clones recommended for release (no hybrids)

title.narrative: Number of released biofortified varieties exchanged and recommended for registration in additional countries.

baseline.value: 80 OFSP varieties released in CIP’s target countries

target.value: 8 OFSP varieties exchanged and at least 2 of these recommended for registration

actual.value: 13 OFSP varieties exchanged; 4 exchanged varieties recommended for registration

comment.narrative: 13 OFSP varieties were exchanged in 2020 among target countries, and 4 exchanged varieties recommended for registration in Kenya (1), Mozambique (2) and Ethiopia (1)

target.value: 5 OFSP varieties exchanged and at least 1 of these recommended for registration

actual.value: 18 OFSP varieties exchanged; 2 existing OFSP varieties registered

comment.narrative: 2 existing OFSP varieties registered in Ethiopia & Kenya. In vitro plantlets of 18 OFSP varieties were exchanged with DR Congo for evaluation and subsequent registration.

target.value: 15 OFSP varieties exchanged and at least 5 of these recommended for registration

actual.value: 30 OFSP varieties exchanged; 9 of these recommended for registration

comment.narrative: 30 OFSP varieties were exchanged among target countries, and 9 exchanged varieties recommended for registration in Kenya (1), Mozambique (2), Malawi (2), Eswatini (3), and Ethiopia (1)

target.value: 15 OFSP varieties exchanged and at least 5 of these recommended for registration

title.narrative: Strengthening and sharing the evidence on the impact of biofortified crops and the effectiveness of different delivery models.
Number of peer-reviewed publications and technical reports assessing the effectiveness and cost-effectiveness of delivery models.

target.value: Peer-reviewed: 2; Technical reports: 4

actual.value: Peer-reviewed: 1; Technical reports: 1

comment.narrative: -1 peer-reviewed publication on cost-effectiveness -1 technical report on scalability Published research on delivery models fell below targets due to the recent pivot towards expanding research targets in this area and lag in publishing timeline; subsequent years are expected to compensate for this shortfall.

target.value: Peer-reviewed: 3; Technical reports: 4

actual.value: Peer-reviewed: 4; Technical reports: 6

comment.narrative: 4 peer-reviewed journal articles and 6 technical reports on effectiveness and cost-effectiveness of delivery models

actual.value: Peer-reviewed: 5; Technical reports: 9

comment.narrative: Peer-reviewed: 5; Technical reports: 9

target.value: Peer-reviewed: 4; Technical reports: 7

actual.value: Peer-reviewed: 2; Policy briefs: 5; Study reports: 5

comment.narrative: -2 peer-reviewed publications on nutrition -At least 5 policy briefs -At least 5 study reports pertaining to nutrition

target.value: Peer-reviewed: 2; Policy briefs: 2; Study reports: 2

actual.value: Peer-reviewed: 4; Policy briefs: 2; Technical reports: 2

comment.narrative: 4 peer-reviewed journal articles, 2 policy briefs and 2 technical reports on biofortified crops and foods and their nutrition impacts.

target.value: Peer-reviewed: 4; Policy briefs: 3; Study reports: 3

actual.value: Peer-reviewed: 5; Policy briefs: 4; Technical reports: 5

target.value: Peer-reviewed: 4; Policy briefs: 4; Study reports: 4

title.narrative: Number of scientific and technical publications on the effects of climatic change on biofortification and linkages between biofortification, diet diversity and agrobiodiversity.

actual.value: 1 peer-reviewed publication

comment.narrative: 1 peer-reviewed publication on assessing drought tolerance of OFSP

target.value: Peer-reviewed: 2, Policy brief: 1, Technical report: 1

title.narrative: Improved utilization of biofortified foods at household and institutional levels.

Number of children under 2 years of age in low income households that are consuming OFSP using the Healthy Baby Tool Kit (counseling card, pre-recorded audio messages, measuring bowl and slotted spoon).

baseline.value: Healthy Baby Tool Kit are not yet in use

target.value: At least 30,000 children under 2 years of age

comment.narrative: At least 30,000 children under 2 years of age through humanitarian programs.

actual.value: 43,518 children under 2 years of age in low-income households are consuming OFSP using the Healthy Baby Toolkit

comment.narrative: 43,518 children under 2 years of age in low-income households are consuming OFSP using the Healthy Baby Toolkit in Bangladesh (6,272), Ethiopia (11,200), Kenya (234) and Uganda (25,812) as beneficiaries of humanitarian programs

target.value: At least 80,000 children under 2 years of age

actual.value: At least 96,566 children under 2 years of age in low-income households are consuming OFSP using the Healthy Baby Toolki

comment.narrative: A total of 96,566 children under 2 years of age and other children in the household below 5 years in low-income households are consuming OFSP using the Healthy Baby Toolkit in Bangladesh (9,053), Ethiopia (16,047), Kenya (27,001) and Uganda (44,465) as beneficiaries of humanitarian programs.

target.value: At least 2,000 children under 2 years of age

comment.narrative: Manufacturing of 15,000 healthy baby tool kits initiated; ready for delivery in March 2020

target.value: At least 90,000 children under 2 years of age

comment.narrative: At least 90,000 children under 2 years of age through humanitarian programs

comment.narrative: A total of 1,014,264 consumers were reached through humanitarian programs in Bangladesh (39,590), Ethiopia (250,690) Kenya (47,694), Uganda (380,568), Malawi (254,920), and Mozambique (40,802).

title.narrative: Improved micronutrient intake of an estimated 34.9 million people of which 17.5 million (50%) are women of child-bearing age, adolescent girls, and children under 5 in participating countries in Africa and South Asia.
Index of the frequency of consumption of selected micro-nutrient rich foods during the past 7 days among target groups.

target.value: 20% increase over baseline.

comment.narrative: Improvement of index of frequency of consumption of selected micro-nutrient rich foods in target communities. Consumption of Vitamin A: 20% increase over baseline.
